title: New Season 6 is a load of S83T
body: I believe that since season 6 has come about with the new changes of mastgeries and a few gameplay mechanics the riot has completely destroyed the fun, now its all about who can one shot people, theres no fun in that, no skill either, I loved the intense long battles not the fucking quickie battles which last about 10 seconds because of the burst that happens

replies.body: I think your problem is Thunderlord's. That's where almost everyone's burst is coming from. It will get nerfed soon, sadly not next patch, but surely the next.
No it won't, every other mastery is getting buffed

> [{quoted}](name=Chicken4dinner,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Pyt5ywEU,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-12-27T07:39:18.235+0000)
>
> No it won't, every other mastery is getting buffed

Except for the shield one, that will just be the same (they should have left it alone on the last patch).
I agree. Hopefully this is not intended gameplay.

I feel like this is kinda true but also I feel like its what makes this game so interesting, that game play changes and things move around and you have to find different ways of doing things, I main ADC and I have been totally deleted by a fed ekko or some other nasty champion but I have also been able to look at my position and change it to be a little after and not get rekt, I would prefer it if tanks had less damage and more tankyness, I am a little sick of a big ass tank with like 4000 HP or more and 200 Armour coming up to me a just one shoting my my poor squishy frail body, but other than that I think people just need to work out how to change their play styles and enjoy the new things thrown at them.

The game will adapt, might see ADCs, Assassins and mages building defensively more often now, who knows! That sure would limit the burst potential, both by lessening their damage output, and reducing the incoming damage also.
I could be completely wrong, but I have a feeling in my loins that GA may become a staple in basically every build over the course of the next few months.
Then again, I'm a filthy bronzie so what do I know.
